channel.title: SvN Repository
channel.description:
I was curious, how would be able to commit, while the SRL SvN will soon be dead?
Is mopar already hosting one? or someone else? if so, the person involved would need the database.

item.title: SvN Repository
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:73, topic:4616”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=6011.msg85519#msg85519 date=1153730944]
cough maybe you can help me? sighs
I can’t commit remember…
And anyway, we could just use this repos until we find a better alternative
[/quote]

can you log into sourceforge? you use that same username and password to commit to the svn[/quote]
Yes i can login into sourceforge and no the user and pass don’t work for my svn

EDIT: I resetted my pass and it works now, so… thats done.

However i do recommend that for now we add the last public release (240) as download until we finish “the first” version

(And i committed new version of my plugin, plz replace the old one with it )

EDIT2:
w00t ^^
I made v2 of SCARBrowser, it loads mozilla as default, but can switch to ie as well
I already committed it and updated the manual, also made a slight bugfix to my plugin, i made this small mistake that i’d only load a scarbrowser if one or more were already opened instead of if none were opened XD
(BTW, for those who haven’t seen it yet, there is a small example for the browser in scripts/examples/browser)

EDIT3: We should be careful what we commit…
I was talking to ruler and he was defenatly using the svn…
We’re not the only one using it clearly, so don’t commit anything you don’t want to leak out to the public

Read full topic

item.title: SvN Repository
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Wizzup?, post:70, topic:4616”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=6011.msg83965#msg83965 date=1153672493]

Why am I able to download the newest version while I didn’t fill in a username or anything?

you dont need a username or password to checkout from the svn, whats it doing?
[/quote]

[dumb question]Hmmm…doesn’t that mean everyone can CheckOut the SvN now? Including non Developers? [/dumb question][/quote]

yes, that is exactly what it means

I have removed the subversion button from the homepage of sourceforge, which means noone can click on it and view it online or anything, but if someone knows what they are doing they can definatly get it, I guess thats the sacrifice you have to make for going open source with sourceforge

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: SvN Repository
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:24, topic:4616”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=6011.msg65540#msg65540 date=1152909522]

it’s about the fact that they’re supposed to be closed source to the public and i can’t commit so i can’t remove them

why can’t you commit?

Doesn’t accept my account, but mopar, reset the svn and do it before ruler gets his claws on our stuff, commit again but not the plugins, packages and manual writer, keep those separed here in the boards.
[/quote]

why doesnt it accept your account? you must be doing somthign wrong

I updated it to revision 2, and removed all of the things that I should have, problem is nothing stops anyone from reverting to revision 1 to get it all back, and I dont think there is anything we can do to fix it

starblaster:

[quote]Invalid User

That user does not exist or is not yet active. [/quote][br][size=1]Posted at: July 14, 2006, 08:13:35 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Kernel Klink link=topic=6011.msg65812#msg65812 date=1152922182]
I’ve registered as “kernel-klink”.

kernel-klink
[/quote]

added, nice to see you here kernel klink, thats your first post :D[/quote]
I maed a new version of my plugin, it now has a function to start the scarbrowser which i fully integrated into srl with a failsafe to only have 1 broser started at most, but i can’t commit, i type in my sourcesourge user and pass and it doesn’t accept it

EDIT: I added the full package… (Password: x6z28fd)

Read full topic

item.title: SvN Repository
item.dc:creator: @Kernel_Klink Kernel Klink
item.description:
@Kernel_Klink wrote:

Good news! I updated once more, and I finished downloading the entire repository. I didn’t even have to use your rar’d repository. But, keep it up there if I do run into more problems.

As of revision #2, does the SRL include work in its entirety? Are Radialwalk and Linearwalk fixed? I’m just curious if everything has changed.

Read full topic

item.title: SvN Repository
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Kernel Klink:

Thanks a lot Mopar! This will help greatly. Yes, I did think I had a firewall blocking, but no, as far as I’m concerned, that’s not the problem. The errors show up about a minute or two after downloading the repository. So, I can get a few files each time I click Update, but it displays those errors not long after. I’ll keep trying to update until I get everything, and I’ll try your rar’d svn. Thanks.

Im hoping you get it, just tell me if you have any more problems

Read full topic

item.title: SvN Repository
item.dc:creator: @Kernel_Klink Kernel Klink
item.description:
@Kernel_Klink wrote:

Thanks a lot Mopar! This will help greatly. Yes, I did think I had a firewall blocking, but no, as far as I’m concerned, that’s not the problem. The errors show up about a minute or two after downloading the repository. So, I can get a few files each time I click Update, but it displays those errors not long after. I’ll keep trying to update until I get everything, and I’ll try your rar’d svn. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: SvN Repository
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Kernel Klink, post:54, topic:4616”]Darnit! I am so flustered! I downloaded the newest version of Tortoise SVN and I still recieve those errors when trying to download the SRL via Tortoise. However, now I do no receive the following message which I did earlier:

Error: Secure connection truncated (https://svn.sourceforge.net)

And it only gives these errors now:

Error: REPORT of '/svnroot/scarsrl/!svn/vcc/default': Could not read response body: Error: Secure connection truncated (https://svn.sourceforge.net)

Sorry to post about this again, I just am still experiencing problems. Does anyone else receive this message, too?[/quote]

its not a problem, keep posting until you get it working

I just rar’d my .svn folder, so stick the .svn in any folder and then you should be able to right click in the folder with .svn in it and click checkout, try it and see what happens

got a firewall blocking it maybe?

Read full topic

item.title: SvN Repository
item.dc:creator: @Kernel_Klink Kernel Klink
item.description:
@Kernel_Klink wrote:

Darnit! I am so flustered! I downloaded the newest version of Tortoise SVN and I still recieve those errors when trying to download the SRL via Tortoise. However, now I do no receive the following message which I did earlier:

Error: Secure connection truncated (https://svn.sourceforge.net)

And it only gives these errors now:

Error: REPORT of '/svnroot/scarsrl/!svn/vcc/default': Could not read response body: Error: Secure connection truncated (https://svn.sourceforge.net)

Sorry to post about this again, I just am still experiencing problems. Does anyone else receive this message, too?

Read full topic
